result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Russell V McDade
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Boulevard, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-27-2022)
Prior: 1450 S 116th St, West Allis, WI 53214
Preliminary hearing on November 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken; and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services. Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A/Witness A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

2:07 PM Defendant Russell V McDade in court, in custody.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Russell V McDade. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
